formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Wsadmin Absolute Path:
formElement.documentation: Path to wsadmin. If the location of wsadmin is in the PATH environment variable, then just the script name can be specified omitting its full path. E.g. '/path/to/wsadmin.sh' or 'wsadmin.bat'.

formElement.label: Application Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the web application to be updated. i.e: 'webapp'.

formElement.label: Content Type:
formElement.documentation: Specifies to type of content to update. Use File option for updating a single file, Partial Application option for updating application partially, Module option to add/update a module to the deployed application, Application option for updating the entire deployed application.

formElement.label: Operation:
formElement.documentation: Specifies to type of operation to perform as part of update procedure. Use Add option to add new content, Update option to update existing content, AddUpdate option to add content and to replace if already exist, Delete option to remove existing content respectively.

formElement.label: Content:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the file that contains the content that you want to update. For example, depending on the content type, the file could be an EAR file, a module, a partial zip, or a single file.Not required for Delete operation.

formElement.label: Content URI:
formElement.documentation: The relative path beginning with the installed application archive file to the file to be replaced or added. For example, if the file is located at com/company/greeting.class in module hello.jar, specify hello.jar/com/company/greeting.class for the relative path

formElement.label: Cluster Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the cluster on which application is deployed.

formElement.label: Server Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the server on which application is deployed.

formElement.label: Additional Parameters:
formElement.documentation: Additional parameters to pass while updating entire application or module/s, if required. For e.g. -nodeployejb, -BindJndiForEJBNonMessageBinding etc.
